title: Ratnapura gemstone enters Guinness Book of World Records
content: A rare star sapphire cluster found in Ratnapura has entered the Guinness Book of World Records as having the world's largest sapphire aggregate.Weighing 503.2 kg, it has received certification as a star sapphire cluster by the GÃ¼belin Gem Lab in Switzerland.The handover of the Guinness Book of World Records certificate for this gemstone took place at Cinnamon Lakeside Hotel in Colombo yesterday (23).Chairman of the National Gem and Jewellery Authority Tilak Weerasinghe said the gem cluster was valued at more than Rs. 2,000 million.It will be placed at auction or in a museum, he said.
